content:
I am trying something like:

require myProjectName from git
  "LOCALDIR"

but not sure if this is the right way. Would there be a documentation that I can find regarding this?

Hi, I found some documentation for this at over here:
https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/tree/master/src/lake#lean-require

require ["<scope>" /] <pkg-name> [@ <version>]
  [from <source>] [with <options>]

then goes on to talk a little bit about how <source> is defined as a <path>, and says:

Lake loads the package located a fixed path relative to the requiring package's directory.

So it looks like what you have as "LOCALDIR" is expected to be a relative path.

oh, hmm, maybe this is not what you're looking for. I guess for local projects with git dependencies we can specify specific revisions. That documentation is located right under the link ^^

from git <url> [@ <rev>] [/ <subDir>]

After checkout, Lake loads the package located in subDir (or the repository root if no subdirectory is specified).

I think you want to do:
from git <path> [@ <rev>] [/ <subDir>]
instead of:
from git <url> [@ <rev>] [/ <subDir>]
@Derek Rhodes Thank you for the information and the link!! This is what I have been looking for, and it works well.
Youngju Song has marked this topic as resolved.
